summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, directing the Government to respond by October 15, 2021, to the defendant's letter regarding a motion deadline under Federal Rule of Evidence 412.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order, who has submitted a letter regarding a motion deadline.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued the order requiring the Government to respond to the defendant's letter.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order requiring the Government to respond to Ghislaine Maxwell's letter regarding a motion deadline under Federal Rule of Evidence 412.

events.title: Government Response Deadline
events.description: The deadline set by the court for the Government to file its response to the defendant's letter.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (20-CR-330).
The order concerns a procedural matter related to a motion deadline under Federal Rule of Evidence 412.
The Government is ordered to respond to the defendant's letter by 5:00 p.m. on October 15, 2021.
The document indicates ongoing legal proceedings in the Maxwell case as of October 2021.
